alert.note: Alert for Dubuque; Jackson; Jones (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 05 at 8:14PM CST until March 05 at 8:30PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CST FOR NORTHWESTERN JO DAVIESS...WESTERN JACKSON...DUBUQUE AND NORTHEASTERN JONES COUNTIES... At 813 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Sherrill to near Oxford Junction, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Fulton and Andrew. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CST for northeastern and east central Iowa. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building.
